Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; glaze fired orange-brown; pinkish white slip; interior glazed with traces of two added white bands; exterior, from top: guilloche band in handle zone; hook maeander frieze between two broad bands; part of lotus bud and flower frieze; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '109' is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0181) (phase 2)
